data.title: Funky Monkey Friday
data.solution:
n = int(input())
day = input()
funkiness = float(input())

output = ''

if day == "friday":
    output = "funky monkey friday " * n
else:
    output = "monkey " * n

output = output[:-1]

if funkiness >= 7:
    output = output.upper()

print(output)
data.statement: The monkeys are partying on the Funky Monkey Island. There are [[n]] monkeys on the island, and the day of the week is [[day]]. The monkeys are feeling a bit funky however, in fact they are feeling [[funkiness]] amount of funky, which is a number from <<0 to 10>>. Print out <<"monkey">> [[n]] times on a single line, separated by spaces. But if the [[day]] is <<"friday">>, then the monkeys are feeling extra funky and you should print out <<"funky monkey friday">> [[n]] times on a single line, separated by spaces. But if [[funkiness]] is greater than or equal to <<7>>, then the monkeys are feeling exceptionally funky and you should print out everything in all <<UPPERCASE>>.

testCases.title: Not Funky 2
testCases.testOut: monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey

testCases.title: Friday 1
testCases.testOut: funky monkey friday funky monkey friday

testCases.title: Friday 2
testCases.testOut: funky monkey friday funky monkey friday funky monkey friday funky monkey friday funky monkey friday funky monkey friday

testCases.title: Very Funky 1
testCases.testOut: FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY

testCases.title: Very Funky 2
testCases.testOut: FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY

testCases.title: Big Funky
testCases.testOut: FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY FUNKY MONKEY FRIDAY

testCases.title: Big Not Funky
testCases.testOut: monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey monkey

data.constraints:
1 <= [[monkeys]] <= 100
[[day]] is one of the days of the week, all lowercase.
0 <= [[funkiness]] <= 10
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read day:string(256)
read funkiness:float
write it's funky monkey time
data.inputDescription:
An integer [[n]] - The number of monkeys
A string [[day]] - The day of the week
A number (not necessarily an integer) [[funkiness]] - A number from <<0>> to <<10>> inclusive
data.outputDescription: Print out <<"monkey">> [[n]] times, unless the [[day]] is <<"friday">>, then print out <<"funky monkey friday">> [[n]] times. If [[funkiness]] is greater than or equal to <<7>>, then print out everything in all <<UPPERCASE>>. Make sure to print out everything on the same line, separated by spaces.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The monkeys are partying on the Funky Monkey Island. There are n monkeys on the island, and the day of the week is day. The monkeys are feeling a bit funky however, in fact they are feeling funkiness amount of funky, which is a number from 0 to 10. Print out "monkey" n times on a single line, separated by spaces. But if the day is "friday", then the monkeys are feeling extra funky and you should print out "funky monkey friday" n times on a single line, separated by spaces. But if funkiness is greater than or equal to 7, then the monkeys are feeling exceptionally funky and you should print out everything in all UPPERCASE.
Input
An integer n - The number of monkeys
A string day - The day of the week
A number (not necessarily an integer) funkiness - A number from 0 to 10 inclusive
Output
Print out "monkey" n times, unless the day is "friday", then print out "funky monkey friday" n times. If funkiness is greater than or equal to 7, then print out everything in all UPPERCASE. Make sure to print out everything on the same line, separated by spaces.
Constraints
1 <= monkeys <= 100
day is one of the days of the week, all lowercase.
0 <= funkiness <= 10
Example
Input
3
monday
2
Output
monkey monkey monkey
